Por favor, es un capo. Aprender a codificar con Horacio es como tener una linterna en medio de la selva de los códigos. Súbanle el sueldo =)
Es la super Woman del código, tener a estos pedazos de profesores en el cohorte hace que la experiencia (intensa) del mundo de la programación sea más enriquecedora. ¡También, súbanle el sueldo =)!
Estoy aprendiendo mucho y valoro la práctica constante. Me siento motivado con lo que voy consiguiendo, aunque a veces moje en lágrimas la consola de datos

No sé si ha habido un fallo de comunicación entre la academia y los profesores con el cambio en el orden y duración de los módulos, pero ha habido una acumulación repentina de proyectos (9 en total). Además, el proyecto de Procesamiento de Imágenes es un despropósito en toda regla, especialmente cuando tanto la teoría como el ejemplo del profesor no utilizan imágenes, lo que dificulta su realización. No soy la única con esta percepción; varios compañeros opinan lo mismo. Luego se nos pide no usar IA, pero si el ejercicio no guarda relación con la teoría, no queda claro qué se espera de nosotros.
Respecto al proyecto final, me ha parecido muy poco acertado formar ya el primer grupo. El miércoles se eligió sin saber cuántos cumplían con el 70% del curso aprobado, porque muchos, como yo, aún tenemos proyectos sin corregir. No me parece justo. Si no se ha corregido todo lo entregado, no debería montarse ningún grupo estando a merced del azar del orden de corrección.

Aunque estoy contenta con el resultado general de la academia, las últimas decisiones (tanto la modificación del orden de los módulos como la arbitrariedad en la formación de los grupos) me han generado una sensación de insatisfacción e impotencia total. Creo que hay muchos aspectos que deben mejorarse. Estas decisiones han deslucido una experiencia que, hasta ese momento, estaba siendo positiva, y creo que sería importante tenerlo en cuenta para futuras ediciones.

La plataforma de la academia funciona bien y el contenido en general es adecuado. Sin embargo, los ejemplos dados en clase y los proyectos muchas veces me resultan difíciles de seguir, ya que en su mayoría están centrados en temas médicos, un ámbito que ni domino ni me interesa. Además de parecerme poco atractivos, me cuesta entenderlos. Aunque los temas inmobiliarios tampoco me resultan especialmente interesantes, al menos puedo seguirlos con mayor facilidad. Creo que debería haber más variedad tanto en los ejemplos como en los datasets de los proyectos, para que sean más accesibles a todos los perfiles.
GitHub y Codespaces funcionan de manera irregular; desde la última actualización, han presentado problemas constantes. Por otro lado, los solucionarios de los proyectos, a partir del módulo de EDA, no están disponibles. No sé si es un error, pero sin ellos, en proyectos tan largos, no siempre es posible saber si se ha llegado correctamente al final.
Muy Útil Javier tiene maneras muy didácticas y claras para poder entender la información.
Muy buena, buena tanda de ejercicios comecocos que con la práctica ayudan mucho

Me gustaria que la plataforma fuera mas completa, se que nos incentivan tambien a investigar, pero para el precio que estamos pagando, me parece curioso que a veces resuelvo mas mis dudas en otras plataformas como datacamp

Recomiendo hacer tutoriales prácticos del paso a paso real que (nosotros dentro de bootcamp al hacer proyectos) se usa cada vez que un nuevo alumno debe aprender a usar GITHUB. Ese detalla inicio de curso sería un plus.

Cada vez peor, los proyectos con datasets incorrectos o poco adecuados para trabajar con ellos, pocas herramientas, soluciones muy ridículas o pobres para realizar dichos proyectos, sin contar los que ni la explicación coincide con el proyecto, no entiendo como un curso que cuesta tanto dinero tenga que buscarme las herramientas fuera de el por mi cuenta

El contenido está bien, pero la plataforma como tal necesita un buen repaso. A veces da errores, se hace poco intuitiva y entorpece en vez de ayudar. Me encanta lo que enseñan, pero la plataforma no está a la altura. Hay que mejorar la experiencia de usuario.  
PD. Y también la de algunas plantillas, puesto que son muy viejas.
Facu brutal estuvimos un montón de tiempo y sin ningún problema ni apuro y aclaró mis dudas al 100%
Very patient, and knowledgeable. Good at explaining things clearly

I would prefer fewer breakout room sessions, or none. Screen sharing & back-and-forth slows things down. Personally, I don't work very efficiently inside the breakout rooms. I learn much better working solo outside class. Then I can ask better questions whenever needed via mentor/Slack. The teacher devoted a lot of time to successfully help me with my project, which is why that might be better suited outside of class, to save time for instruction.

Yes and no. Yes, he encouraged participation (with breakout rooms). No, my doubts were not resolved because I do not learn very well in breakout rooms -- I learn much better with independent work and asking questions *when needed*.

Same question as #1, so same answer: I would prefer fewer breakout room sessions, or none. Screen sharing & back-and-forth slows things down. Personally, I don't work very efficiently inside the breakout rooms. I learn much better working solo outside class. Then I can ask better questions whenever needed via mentor/Slack. The teacher devoted a lot of time to successfully help me with my project, which is why that might be better suited outside of class, to save time for instruction (he is an excellent teacher which is why I wish we could have had more regular format instruction).

Aunque finalmente se unió, esto ocurrió después del momento en que se esperaba que se dividieran los grupos. Me preocupa que, al avanzar hacia temas más complejos como JavaScript, la falta de apoyo al inicio de la clase pueda afectar la dinámica y el aprendizaje del grupo especialmente si somos dividos en grupos y el profesor no tiene apoyo para cubrir todos los grupos.

He notado que el asistente del profesor se une una hora tarde a la clase. No tengo claro si esa es su hora de entrada habitual, pero esa demora terminó sobrecargando al profesor, quien intentó atender todas las preguntas por su cuenta. Como resultado, varias dudas que se escribieron por el chat fueron ignoradas, ya que el profesor se concentró en responder únicamente las que se hacían por micrófono. Esto genera preocupación de cara a las próximas sesiones, especialmente cuando empecemos a ver temas más exigentes que generen muchas mas preguntas que el profesor no pueda manejar por su cuenta.

La clase fue participativa, gracias a la iniciativa de los estudiantes y la disposición del profesor para responder. Se generó una dinámica fluida a través del intercambio directo, lo que mantuvo el interés de quienes estábamos presentes.

The pacing was great. The breakout room session was 30 minutes which is just the right length, not too long. Alex had different students share their screen to learn through practice with the whole class following along, which really helped me quickly learn the basics of the command line. Alex did a great job answering questions that students had while completing the interactive challenges.

Thomas, the teacher's assistant (since this question is asked twice, I am rating both) was available to answer questions and clarified the grading system for the current project, which eased the mind of many students who were confused about how to submit the assignment. He sounded eager to help and passionate about the material.

Yes, Alex encouraged participation by having students take turns sharing their screens and working with the entire class. He also had 30 minute breakout rooms for a quick intro challenge to the lesson which was just the right length, not too long. He eased my doubts about how challenging the command line would be, and eased my anxiety about the class format with the right mix of whole-class versus individual participation.
Su método es muy bueno

Las explicaciones fueron claras y bien estructuradas. El profesor no solo presentó los conceptos de forma ordenada, sino que también se tomó el tiempo de resolver dudas, tanto generales como específicas, lo cual enriqueció la comprensión del grupo.

El profesor hizo un excelente trabajo al dirigir la clase. Mantuvo el control del grupo, explicó con claridad y supo adaptarse de forma efectiva a las circunstancias. Se notó su experiencia y dominio del tema, lo cual generó confianza y permitió avanzar con buen ritmo.

Quiero resaltar especialmente la capacidad del profesor para aprovechar al máximo el tiempo disponible. En lugar de repetir el ejercicio del excuse generator, que muchos ya habíamos hecho en el prework, optó por avanzar con nuevo contenido. Esa decisión demuestra criterio, flexibilidad y conocimiento del programa, y fue algo que personalmente valoré mucho.

La clase fue muy dinámica e interactiva. El profesor supo mantener la atención del grupo y generar un ambiente participativo. Gracias a su enfoque y manejo del contenido, pudimos avanzar más de lo esperado, lo que hizo que la sesión se sintiera productiva y motivadora.

There have been many ongoing issues with codespaces, that I have been able to work around. Ive been using VScode and moving code over. Also have had some minor issues with the order of reading materials and the learnpack assignments.

Steven is very patient and detailed with his lessons. He gives us plenty of time to work through our projects and always takes suggestions to help facilitate our learning. Steven always does his best to walk us through any questions and problems.

I think the content can be more detailed when it comes to the material we are learning. There isn't a lot of opportunity to practice new concepts and while each concept is connected, it doesn't flow in a way where we can make the correlation between each concept learned. It can make the process of learning Javascript a bit more difficult.
Steven is great. He's a wealth of knowledge and always willing to help.
Eddie is awesome as well. He knows his stuff!
Very Great, he is very knowledgeable, personable/patient, and eager to assist.
H'e a bit scatter brained but he cares a lot and goes above and beyond to make sure we understand.

I believe the program has provided a lot of value and material. I think the pacing of the course itself can be more detailed. En general, mi experiencia ha sido positiva en cuánto a conocimiento y claridad, pero creo que podría mejorar el tono y la manera en la que se comunica con el grupo. A veces siento que nos trata con condescendencia, casi como si fuéramos niños. Por ejemplo, ya ha dicho en varias ocasiones frases como “esto lo he repetido muchas veces” como regañándonos, no nos trata como un igual, lo que me hace sentir infantilizada más que guiada, entiendo que su intención es reforzar ideas clave, pero a mí personalmente me genera cierta incomodidad y somos todos adultos, nadie es más que nadie, creo que podría darnos la misma información de una manera más empática y cercana.

Durante las dos primeras semanas y ahora mi experiencia con Sergio ha sido excelente. Su cercanía, empatía y disposición marcaron la pauta desde el inicio, generando un ambiente de confianza que nos permitió hablar en público y plantear dudas con facilidad. Sus frases como “no hay preguntas tontas” nos hacían sentir validados y escuchados. Cuando alguien duda, lo anima con un tono cercano, no autoritario.

En ciertas ocasiones el maestro destina demasiado tiempo a revisión de ejemplos muy puntuales quitando tiempo a ver cuestiones teóricas más generales o aplicables a más problemas. Hoy fue así, pasamos casi 2 horas y media resolviendo una pregunta ( referente a economía) que ni siquiera era duda de la mayoría de la  clase. Son clases donde me distraigo y disperso y creo que son una pérdida de tiempo, no porque haya pocas personas que no lo entendían ( creo que todos merecemos el tiempo y el espacio para las dudas ) pero él lo revolvió tanto que terminó siendo un agobio. A veces sucede igual cuando se pone a programar…. No hay duda de que él domina el tema tanto teórico como práctico, pero en ocasiones las sesiones son muy poco pedagógicas. Ayudaría que preparara sus clases con diapositivas ordenadas y una dirección más concreta del tema y el objetivo del día. Sin duda estoy aprendiendo muchísimo y espero que esta “crítica” le haga ver que si pusiera más recursos pedagógicos, sería mejor

Yo lo dije la vez pasada, es buen mentor, pero me parece explica para personas que ya saben, no para personas que estamos iniciando, sus explicaciones son a detalle pero con los ejercicios de ejemplo siento que son muy complicado al inicio, aunque al final vas entiendo poquito a poco, creo que deberia empezar con ejemplos desde cero y muy, pero muy basicos, luego ir a lo mas complejo.

Sinceramente, esperaba más del curso en cuanto a organización, contenido y dinámica. Hay falta de coordinación entre el profesor y su asistente, y no todas las grabaciones están disponibles, lo que complica el repaso. La docente principal no es motivadora ni dinámica; incluso se le ha escuchado bostezar en clase. Realizamos ejercicios que no se ajustan a nuestro nivel, generando frustración. Aunque completé un proyecto al 100%, no siento que pueda aplicarlo, ya que tuve que desarrollarlo identificando errores por mi cuenta, sin una guía clara. Comenté en clase que no había podido avanzar y no recibí orientación ni seguimiento. Además, los comentarios en el chat no suelen ser leídos. Los tutoriales de apoyo son confusos, incompletos o desactualizados, lo que me obliga a buscar información extra por mi cuenta. El curso tiene potencial, pero se deben mejorar la pedagogía, el contenido y la atención al estudiante.

La verdad, me gustaría tener otra profesora. A pesar de que está para ayudarnos, no siento que lo haga realmente. En varias ocasiones no brinda el soporte esperado; incluso cuando un compañero necesitaba ayuda y había tiempo, prefirió no intervenir, argumentando que las indicaciones estaban en GitHub. Entiendo que parte del aprendizaje es autónomo, pero también necesitamos guía y acompañamiento. Además, sus clases no son dinámicas ni motivadoras, y muchas veces no responde a los mensajes en el chat. Completé un proyecto por mi cuenta, resolviendo errores sin retroalimentación. Creo que hay mucho por mejorar en cuanto a compromiso con los estudiantes.
En este momento, no me sentiría cómodo recomendándolo. Mi experiencia no ha sido la mejor y creo que hay aspectos importantes que deberían mejorar antes de poder sugerirlo a alguien más.

La plataforma me ha parecido buena, funciona bien y es ordenada. Sin embargo, el contenido ha sido regular. Debería ser más claro y directo, ya que tener que revisar todo en GitHub para entender bien fue confuso en varios momentos. Me costó seguir algunas instrucciones por falta de estructura o explicación detallada.
Muy buena hasta ahora todos los proyectos han sido un reto, eso me mantiene muy motivado
Todo muy bien, el profe Samuel es excelente.

Aveces la plataforma se cae pero la mayoria del tiempo es bastante fácil de usar. Con el contenido hay un tema y sería que hay muy pocos proyectos y practicas diferentes por tema, normalmente sólo hay 1 por tema y eso no nos permite aplicar lo que nos explican en diferentes situaciones y además hay muy poco espacio entre temas, basicamente hay un dia o maximo 2 (los fines de semana) para absorber cada tema porque a la siguiente clase ya hay contenido nuevo. Pero de nuevo digo que el profe Samuel lo hace genial para ayudarnos a mantener el ritmo.

[+10:] Definitely, if I knew anyone interested in a software career. [?:] This answer may change depending on the helpfulness in getting a job.

[+5:] Alejandro Sanchez and team built an amazing, well-structured platform from scratch! [+5:] Creating projects is so fun! [-1:] The "reload" button does not work once Codespaces server times out (I have to enter "npm run start" and click "open in browser" again every time). [-1:] Minor LearnPack bugs.

[-1:] Class is too late -- please make one PT cohort earlier than 6pm! [+5:] I learn professional tools (GitHub, commits, etc.) not taught in my college software development program. [+5:] Creating working projects is very exciting!
[+4:] Alex always has a positive attitude. [+3:] Alex breaks down material into steps. [+3:] Alex gives individual help.

[+4:] Thomas gives insight into professional relevance of the material. [+3:] He presents better solutions to make the code more organized. [+3:] He pushes students to think through questions and go above the minimum. [-1:] Occasional language.

While I think that the structure of our lessons are well thought-out, I find myself using the course as an outline rather than something I can follow along and practice. While I know it is designed for easy access and coding, from a personal standpoint I would like to learn industry standard practices such as cloning the repository locally. While the option was available in our projects, we are often pushed to use CodeSpaces which has had many technical issues. While I understand the goal is to do our own research for projects, the instructions are often vague and not many resources are provided for helping guide us through the project. Some resources are outdated as well. I think 4Geeks provides a great outline for Full-Stack development, however, I feel that it is missing some elements that make learning more effective.

The platform itself has been easy to use and access. It is easy to navigate the course on the 4Geeks webpage. While I think the content covers a lot of decent information, I also understand that much of the content was translated from another language making it difficult to follow sometimes. I find myself outlining the lesson and having to compare and find other resources to fill in gaps of understanding. Again, while I understand the goal is to facilitate a habit of research, having an unstable structure makes it difficult to know what to research for in a broader aspect.
I believe that this program is well composed and has a great flow of progression. I feel informed, and have had minimal issues with the code spaces.
He's great fun and great with motivation, but not so great at conveying a clear message. He insists on coding in real time, but often has to backtrack his words, so he can be hard to follow at times.

Eddie is the team MVP. He's quite, but knowledgeable, and he makes you think your way through things, but doesn't leave you to drown. If he sees you're heading the wrong direction, he'll gently nudge you back to the right path. He's been a great asset to the learning process.
I love what you guys are doing, and I have already referred you to a few associates.
Minor glitches, but overall a great platform and a great roadmap through these subjects.

My experience in this current cohort has been going well. I think that while the structure and material we are learning to solid, it is a lot of information to learn in 10 weeks. I believe that there are a couple missing components that would with project configuration. Much of my own study is primarily from outside sources. According to our mentors, the information is a few years outdated.

Steven has been very proactive in creating lessons and walking us through the content we are learning. His experience and knowledge is very prevalent in his lessons and he is always open to feedback. It is very evident that he cares deeply about our learning and understanding of the material.

I think the course has great potential but there are a few concerns that I have had, and have spoken on that have not been addressed. 
1. When working in code spaces there are far to many technical issues to make learning enjoyable. As someone who has been computer literate since childhood I have had far too many issues that made me feel as if continuing this course is even worth it.
2. The core instruction meaning the reading material was hard to connect with, and could have been presented better. For example there were times I did not understand the wording of a lesson because the grammar was unnecessarily wordy.
3. The pace of the instruction is at break neck speed, and as a visual learner I am finding it difficult to understand and absorb concepts I've only been given less than 24 hours to understand. 
4. Although I am finally beginning to grasp some concepts I do not feel confident that I will be able to speak to the harder parts of the languages I've seen thus far.
Eddie is a great asset, and a big help when to. Especially when I can't get with Steven I appreciate that Eddie is there to explain any concerns I'm having with my code.

I find myself seeking outside materials to understand what this course should be helping me to understand. I need the concepts in this course explained to me as if I am a five year old, and this course just doesn't do that for me. If the readings and exercises were presented in a way I could understand and feel comfortable grasping maybe then I would be more confident recommending this material to others. As an example I am finding myself seeking out the videos of the SuperSimpleDev on YouTube, and although I am starting from the beginning of his videos, I know that once I complete tasks from the examples his videos give me, I have a better understanding. This course I think is more suited to those who are not just beginning code, and is better suited to people who already have some type of foundational knowledge of the languages being presented, and just need the structure to learn better. The materials are also outdated, and learning a tutorial from a 7 year old video is nuts.

Please refer to my previous comments about how I feel about the content, and platform, but just to reiterate. Code spaces is unnecessarily buggy, the course readings need to be plain and clear. Learn to explain the code to someone in their infancy stage of learning code. I feel this would be the best way to succeed or continue forward in the Dallas market. Actually listen to the student when they are addressing their concerns about the technical issues. I also think that the pre-work should include learning how to navigate GitHub instead of waiting until further within the course, this could help alleviate frustration. 10 weeks is not enough time to learn extremely hard concepts if the person learning is not given a chance to absorb and practice the concepts before presenting the next concept.

I enjoy learning in a more structured manner than I have been able to in the past. I do like having access to learn from a knowledgeable teacher. I’m happy that we have more hybrid learning days as the drive was eating hours from my day and leaving no time to study or complete assignments. I do wish I had more time to study and better understand the concepts instead of completing the projects since there are a lot of projects at a time. I would like more guidance on how to complete projects and implement best coding practices
Ryan's very helpful, he walked through on the code and what changes needed to be made to have the program working efficiently

The experience hasn't been as great as I thought it was. After being in the course for about 5 or 6 weeks I thought we would have more time to understand the course work and to be able to grasp the concepts of each programming language at least 2 or 3 days doing each project to get the understanding. It hard to learn when you have a new project due everyday, an you haven't understood the previous assignment I think we should had more time on each project at least 2 days no more than 3 days so we can get the full understanding of the projects to help flow along with the curriculum. I understand we signed up knowing this was like a full time job, but the original place was supposed to b Downtown so most of us had made the arrangements to go Downtown. When the location changed at the last minute it changed mostly everyone schedule most of us it take hour an 30 mins to get there it takes me 2 hours to get there and back home so it make it harder for me to study because I get home late.

Mi experiencia en 4Geeks ha sido increíble, he aprendido muchísimo, me han acompañado y siguen haciéndolo vaya, estoy encantado con su trabajo unos profes increíbles y una formación magnifica, 100% recomendable si queréis entrar en el sector laboral.

Mi experiencia en 4Geeks Academy fue alucinante. Entré sin saber absolutamente nada de programación y terminé creando mi propia página web desde cero. El programa full stack es intenso, pero súper completo y bien estructurado. Los mentores siempre están ... disponibles y explican todo con muchísima paciencia. Realmente vale la pena si estás buscando aprender desarrollo web de forma seria y práctica. ¡Recomendadísimo!

Si estás buscando un bootcamp donde te lleven de la mano en cada paso, este no es para ti. Es un programa que exige mucha dedicación, especialmente si vienes de una rama totalmente distinta al desarrollo. Hay que investigar mucho por cuenta propia y comprometerse ... al 100% para realmente sacarle provecho. Dicho esto, la escuela ofrece un gran apoyo. Hay muchas mentorías disponibles y el equipo está siempre dispuesto a ayudar. Hans, en particular, es un excelente profesor. Te exige, te motiva y te da el empujón necesario para que saques lo mejor de ti. Además, brinda mucho contexto sobre cómo es realmente el trabajo en la industria. En cuanto a la búsqueda de empleo, la escuela te respalda muchísimo en todo el proceso. Pero quiero destacar especialmente a Melisa: es una genia en lo que hace. Si tienes la oportunidad de recibir su guía, aprovéchala al máximo. En resumen, es un bootcamp desafiante pero muy valioso. Si estás dispuesto a esforzarte y comprometerte, vale totalmente la pena.

Me encantó la metodología práctica y eficiente del bootcamp, el acompañamiento, las tutorías y la disposición de todo el personal para ayudarme a desarrollar todas las habilidades necesarias. Recomendado al 100%, si de verdad estás comprometido los resultados ... serán asombrosos.

I started the course without any prior knowledge. From the very first moment, I had the full support of the mentors, both in the classes and when it came to submitting projects. It has been an incredible experience, as they have made me passionate about ... the world of web programming, and I want to continue learning. I was able to learn about numerous languages, such as HTML, CSS, React, SQL, Python, and many other technologies. The support they provide us when creating a professional profile and searching for a job is also very valuable. In short, it is the best bootcamp currently available.

Empecé con dudas de si la programación era para mi o no, y he acabado enamorado de la programación gracias a la atención y dedicación del grupo al completo, han hecho fácil lo que pudiese parecer difícil, muy agradecido. Sin duda alguna 100 % recomendable ...

Hice un bootcamp con esta academia y la verdad solo tengo cosas buenas que decir sobre ella. Durante todo el proceso me han acompañado y motivado, incluso ahora me están ayudando con la búsqueda de empleo (a crear mi imagen de marca y a prepararme para ... entrevistas). Algo que me preocupaba al principio era si podía alcanzar los objetivos ya que partía del 0 y tenía que conciliar con mi trabajo, pero la academia se aseguró de darme todas las herramientas necesarias para llegar al nivel esperado. Definitivamente la recomiendo.

I decided to enroll in 4Geeks Academy to deepen my knowledge of web development, and I can confidently say it was one of the best decisions I’ve ever made. From the start, the administrative organization was impeccable, always available to address any ... concerns and make me feel fully supported. The classes were phenomenal: clear, well-structured, and with a practical approach that motivates you to keep learning on your own. The tutors and mentors are outstanding, always ready to guide you, answer questions, and provide constructive feedback. Their constant support and patience made the learning process incredibly enriching. Furthermore, the environment is highly motivating, turning every lesson into not just an opportunity to learn but also a challenge you truly enjoy tackling. I leave this experience equipped with practical tools, confidence in my skills, and a strong desire to continue growing in the field of web development.

Excelente formación para quien quiera dedicarse a este mundo de la programación, el sistema es solido y tiene un grupo de personas increíbles trabajando allí! 100% recomendado. La enseñanza es super práctica y didáctica para aprender inclusive desde cero. ...

Buenísima experiencia, una formación muy completa y sobretodo un acompañamiento ideal que te pone las cosas mucho más fáciles. Contenido muy completo y dinámicas de aprendizaje positivas. Bootcamp inmersivo que hace que termines con buenas sensaciones. ...

My experience with 4Geeks has been truly transformative. From day one, the team was committed to providing me with the support and tools I needed to achieve my professional goals. The Career Support program was especially valuable. They helped me refine ... my resume and LinkedIn profile, highlighting my strengths in an effective way. Additionally, the interview practice sessions prepared me tremendously to face the selection process with confidence. Thanks to the solid backing of 4Geeks, I was able to quickly secure a relevant job in my field. The team was by my side every step of the way, offering guidance and encouraging me to make the most of the opportunities that arose. Undoubtedly, the experience at 4Geeks has been a key factor in the advancement of my career. I wholeheartedly recommend this program to anyone seeking to give a significant boost to their professional trajectory.

My experience at 4Geeks Academy has been amazing. During my time there, I learned so much, not only in technical knowledge but also in real-world, practical skills. The academy has a very hands-on approach, allowing me to work on projects and learn effectively ... and directly. Additionally, thanks to the excellent Career Support process, I was able to secure a job where I feel very comfortable and fulfilled. I would definitely recommend 4Geeks Academy

My experience with 4Geeks has been incredible. I've learned a tremendous amount, and while there's still much to master to reach a more competitive level, they’ve provided me with an outstanding foundation. Thanks to their program, I secured a formal ... job immediately after finishing the fullstack course. I’m deeply grateful!

My experience with the 4Geeks Academy has been very positive. Before starting, they explain the knowledge program that you are going to have very well, and there is a prework before officially starting the bootcamp so that you can start with a base. The ... entire team is very involved. The classes are recorded and there is always a teacher who has mentoring to answer your questions.

4Geeks Academy presents a very well-designed FullStack bootcamp, in my opinion. It provides a fair amount of knowledge in several technologies that are heavily demanded in the market nowadays. BUT, this is not a miraculous solution; it all depends on your dedication and time. You still need to learn A LOT on your own if you want to succeed quickly (I've been working on my programming skills almost like a full-time job since I started the bootcamp, and it took me 6 months after finishing it to land a job). Don't get me wrong: this is the same for every bootcamp. It's impossible to reach a professional level in programming in just 3 months by only attending classes. That being said, if you think you have the time and the strength, 4Geeks is just an amazing academy. Not only do they teach you the skills, but they also teach you how to keep learning. Also, I probably wouldn't have had this job opportunity if it weren't for the amazing career support they provide after the course. Now I know how to navigate this world, and that's just as valuable as the skills themselves. I absolutely recomend you to check what they have to offer!

The representative on the phone was giving me prices, even before we discussed the payment options, that don't match anything on the website. As a matter of fact, their price for the same online course varies from 3850-4600 if you pay upfront, whereas ... the representative was trying to sell me on the plan for 5300 telling me that he just applied some 1k discount to make it sound like a good deal. When I noticed when the website says and mentioned to him, on the next day he offered me to pay 4500. Overall, everything on their website is super confusing i.e. "*Discount up to €1700. From €4600 instead of €6300" or "pay upfront and get a discount", but turns out there is no additional discount. Anyhow, when I called him out on this later and tried to clarify how they come up with their prices, he avoided the question, got very rude and demanded that I pay up 6300 for the whole thing. On top of everything, this is a coding bootcamp, but they have failed to provide a safe payment system online and instead ask to make a weird wire transfer, or pay with crypto, which is super sketchy. They say you can pay by card, but that is actually not the case. These people just can't be trusted.

For the past 16 weeks, I have been learning how to completely develop a web application at 4Geeks, and I have really enjoyed it. In the first weeks of the course, we covered the basics of front-end development (html, css, javascript, and react), as well ... as complementary technologies required for working in an office environment (git, command line, etc). Subsequently, the training focused on interacting with APIs, before creating one with SQLAlchemy, Python, and Flask. As well, we learned how to limit access to the API information. The last part of the course was a four-week final project that consisted of building a complete web application that put all the knowledge learned in the course to the test through a stream on the academy's YouTube channel. In each class, we had a teacher and an assistant who taught us the bases to carry out the exercises of the program meticulously. I have also benefited from unlimited mentoring provided by the school, which helped me to strengthen my knowledge and resolve any doubts I had throughout the bootcamp. In my opinion, the most valuable aspect of the academy is that all the teachers and mentors have been very willing to thoroughly teach me the content and to ensure that I understand the technologies. It's an atmosphere that's focused on total collaboration and helping you learn as much as possible (even remotely). 4Geeks is a great place to learn how to program, and with dedication on your part, you will surely learn a great deal about programming.

Muchos son los valientes que se embarcan en el heroico camino del aprendizaje del desarrollo de software desde las profundidades del desconocimiento, virando su destino de la aburrida vida ordinaria al maravilloso mundo del desarrollo... y terminan perdidos, ... sin los conocimientos o las habilidades necesarias para aprovechar las herramientas a su disposición. Bueno, pues eso no les hubiera ocurrido de haber estudiado en 4Geeks Academy. Con un currículum bien pensado, focalizado en enseñar de manera eficiente y rápida, pero con la profundidad necesaria las herramientas más demandadas en la actualidad, en 16 intensas semanas de aprendizaje estarás preparado para dar tus primeros pasos en este mundo entrando con buen pie. En este momento, si bien está sujeto a cambios para mantenerse siempre a la vanguardia del mercado, se enseña JavaScript con React para el desarrollo Frontend y Python con Flask para el desarrollo Backend, además de otras herramientas y conocimientos básicos, siendo estas tecnologías unas de las más demandadas (si no las más) en el actual mercado laboral del desarrollo. Si bien el curso es intenso y exigente, 4Geeks Academy ofrece mucho más de lo que demanda y, sin duda, puede ser el punto de inflexión perfecto en la vida de muchas personas que, como yo, opten por dar un giro radical a su vida haciendo un cambio de carrera y accediendo a uno de los mercados más grandes (y con mejores sueldos) en la actualidad. Además de esto, cabe destacar que, no solo cuentan con profesores y mentores muy bien preparados, si no que ofrecen apoyo para la búsqueda de empleo (incluyendo preparación para las temidas entrevistas técnicas) y un sistema de mentorías vitalicio, con lo que siempre podrás contar con el apoyo de la academia, incluso tiempo después de haber concluido la formación básica en ella.

Growing bootcamp to start learning in the programming world. Great to have mentorships forever. The 4 Geeks platform is easy to use and friendly. They are improving the platform what is nice that they are worried in be better everyday. If you work hard ... you can have the possibilty to be mentor

It was a very good experience, the teachers were amazing, they were always ready to help us no matter when or how, and the academy really cares about how we feel and communicated with us a lot providing us career support and creating a big community between ... students.

Después de haber terminado el bootcamp de Full Stack Developer, puedo decir que estoy totalmente satisfecho de haberme decidido a hacerlo. Clases amenas, profesores competentes y organización enfocada a poder aprender mucho en poco tiempo. Eso sí, debes ... estar dispuest@ a dedicarle muchas horas de estudio y tomartelo muy en serio si quieres aprovecharlo al máximo.

Todo el curso está bastante bien planteado, desde el prework hasta la presentación del proyecto final. Me encanta la metodología utilizada, donde cada día tenemos que poner en práctica lo hemos visto en clase, de esta forma vamos consolidando todo lo ... vamos aprendiendo. Y además siempre que tengamos alguna dificultad podemos recurrir a las mentorías y sacar todas nuestras dudas. Es increíble lo que he podido aprender en tan poco tiempo.

The pros are that you will have a large community supporting you. At the beginning you will be almost alone in the new world of programming when you do the pre-work for the course. However, once you get to know your teacher and the rest of the students ... you will gradually realize that this seemingly lonely environment is actually a community where we all face the same challenges. We all support each other gradually, of course at the beginning you will be somewhat reticent, reserved, because it is not normal to find yourself in a world where community support is the norm and being alone, reserved, isolated without helping others or being helped is the least usual, although you can opt for that path, but I warn you that it will not be easy to opt for that path. This is a path of challenges, defeats that soon become triumphs. At the beginning you feel helpless and incapable but as you advance, you overcome stagnations and generate those euphoric victories, you become addicted to this world of programming. Of course, all this is thanks to the immense support that you have from all sides along the bootcamp, you forget that you are in remote because as soon as you ask for help, (yes, you have to get used to confess something as difficult as "I can't, I'm stuck, I don't see the error" and they tell you, you are missing a semicolon in that line) all the mechanisms move in your favor to convert into victories those jams that seem to have no end. In conclusion, this bootcamp delivers like no other. It teaches you to be passionate about this world, but it also makes you wonder if this is really the path you want to follow. Because no matter how smart you are, this river only flows if you are really determined to move forward without fear of waterfalls. The teachers and mentors are wonderful, at least the one I had, Emanuel Martinez, taught me more than any of my teachers throughout my life. Victor and Marcos make things clear and always encourage you to keep going despite everyone. The treatment is personal, the platforms are ready to be used, and they help you at all times, even when they let you hit the ground with your face. After finishing the bootcamp they help you build a resume you would have never imagined, perfect your linkedin and know well what you need to do to get the attention of recruiters. And rest assured that if you don't know how to tackle a programming or job search problem you have lifetime mentoring, the 4Geeks Slack community that is IMMENSE and all the support of your mentors at your disposal. The best investment of my entire life. Thanks to this bootcamp my life finally has a way to go after being more than 5 years spinning from one job to another like a spinning top. Thank you, 4Geeks Academy

The title perfectly describes my experience with this course and with everyone involved in this school. They go the extra mile to help you in whatever you need to finish your projects, exercises or to make you move forward in your career. After doing ... this course, for sure, you can do your own app with all the intricacies.

I’ve been wanting to learn how to code but never found the time with a full time job, but then I saw 4GeeksAcademy offering a part time full stack bootcamp, and decided to spend a few hard months to learn. The part time structure was with 1 mentor and ... 1 assistant throughout the whole course for each lesson of 3 hours, 3 times a week, with a flip classroom concept of students are to learn before the class, and listen to explanation in class after already having gone through the material. The bootcamp has a good structure easing in the ‘coding mindset’ with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and eventually SQL and Python. If I were to give a negative feedback, it would be that the slowly easing in front end was making it rather easy to digest, but when it came to backend and endpoints, it was rather rushed comparing to the frontend part of the course - although I have to say I wasn’t an example student studying coding hardcore pushing everyday. For a full time working person, this is manageable, although I missed a few classes while traveling, Marta the mentor of my bootcamp offered mentorship sessions, to explain topics that I missed. I would definitely recommend - hours wise this is perfect for someone working full time office hours, although the 3x3 hours per week is not to be taken lightly - students are expected to learn and code on their own outside of the classes, to be able to follow the designed learning path. Mentors and assistants are very nice and friendly, passionate about coding as well as getting people to learn - the course also creates a great community within the class of ~6 people in my case, I believe it’s maximum 14 people in one class. There’s also lifetime support on the slack channels, finding a job, or just mentorship on anything. After having researched 4Geeks, Wyncode, and IronHack, I settled on 4Geeks due to small class sizes, instructors' professional experience, and overall atmosphere. The smaller class atmosphere, I think, was far and away the largest advantage. I believe ... we had a 3-1 ratio of instructors to students which made for a fantastic learning environment considering the naturally frustrating challenges when learning to program. When I was learning on my own prior to the bootcamp, said challenges would often halt my progress and force me to take at least a few days of rest. With the support of mentors and experienced professionals immediately available (namely our teacher, Nacho), I was able to overcome such obstacles more quickly and with less energy spent on being upset. What's more, however, is I felt 4Geeks truly facilitated that "A-ha!" moment in programming to connect the dots. When you learn on your own, you often find yourself doing isolated exercises like learning how to write a for loop or an if-statement, etc., but don't really understand the point of those expressions outside of the immediate problem. 4Geeks, though, is absolutely phenomenal at piecing together concepts, expressions, and object-oriented programming for students. As a result, those formerly isolated exercises start to fit into the larger picture and once some clarity/understanding emerges you only become more interested, more invested, and more motivated to learn as much as possible and put your understanding to work in real-world applicable projects. I'm completely thrilled with the knowledge, experience, opportunities, and support 4Geeks continues to offer me and could not possibly have asked for more.

All in all, I'm honored to have been part of a program that sponsored my growth and taught me invaluable skills for the future.

The choice of a relevant full stack boot camp is particularly challenging for small businesses and startups, since they usually have limited budgets and, thus, need a technology stack that provides the most bang for the buck to get their projects off ... the ground. 4Geeks Academy provided me with the stack tool knowledge to get my project off the ground based on: 1) Type of Web Application: Functions, integrations, processing heavy loads, and low latency. 2) Time to market: Solution resources and libraries, integration with third-party solutions, development trends availability, documentation and developer community, testing, and maintenance. 3) Security: Technologies stacks that allow the developer to create secure applications. 4) Scalability: Horizontal scalability, which means the ability of a web application to accommodate more requests, and be able to work if the number of users grows. Vertical scalability, which means the ability to add new components to a web application without damaging its performance.

What attracted me to 4Geeks Academy originally was the option of attending a part time cohort. For me, it meant I was able to continue my professional uninterrupted by a 3-4 month full-time course. I went in Mon & Wed 6-9 and Sat 9-12. Starting the cohort ... was a bit overwhelming for me as I had to get used to retraining myself how to approach a problem. The instructors at the academy do a pretty good job at trying to minimize the learning curve, but in reality they can only do so much with ~4 months of time to play with. Being a part-time course, a good portion of the learning falls on you and your motivation in your personal time. A lot of the assignments were the type where you learn *just* enough in class to go home and apply it yourself. Then, come back to the next class with any questions or concerns. There were absolutely times that were frustrating, and those frustrating moments hit everyone at different points. Luckily the team was very supportive/encouraging, and we managed to develop a kind of support group within the classmates. The course focused heavily on JavaScript/Reactjs for a large chunk of the time which, looking back, I appreciate because it’s the thing that I fell back on the most during the job interview that I got hired in. If you’re wondering whether they can teach you how to code - the answer is yes, but you have to put in a considerable amount of effort and time as well. They’ll lead you to the stream but you have to be the one to drink. 4Geeks has a well developed ecosystem of online resources as well as their knowledgeable staff that’ll do everything in their power to make sure you can surmount new topics and concepts. What’s was crazy for me was, because of imposture syndrome, (which you’ll likely have) I didn’t realize how much I had learned and was capable of until the very end when I had a functional final project that I was showing off to my peers. Above all, though, the most personally valuable skill I gained from the course was learning *how* to learn and teach myself. If I had been told that learning to learn would be one of my major take-always before signing up, I probably would have rolled my eyes. In reality, though, yes learning how to code is a big accomplishment (and with effort, you will), but in such a quickly evolving tech landscape where everything you need to know is available for free online, the most powerful tool you can have is your ability to pick up new skills and tricks to evolve with it. From what I saw, 4Geeks was working behind the scenes to make sure you gained that ability before they set you off into the world. 4Geeks hosts in-house meetups with local business from time-to-time to introduce their students to the industry. They’re a good opportunity make connections with local leaders as well as network with new and former 4Geeks students. I’ve heard of some students leveraging them to land interviews. I managed to get hired for my first tech job just a little before graduating (so I can’t personally speak on post-grad job support) which was great and very possible, but not exactly the norm. A few of my classmates also recently got hired within a few months after graduating (one of which I know what’s receiving job support from the academy). What’s amazing is after graduating I’d come back to 4Geeks whenever there was something that I couldn’t figure out at the new job and they (Alejandro and others) would *always be willing to set aside time for me and smooth out my confusions. All-in-all I would definitely recommend 4Geeks with the caveat that you only get out of it what you put in. However, if you’re motivated to change your life and can weather some inevitably stressful moments, you’ll do fine and be well positioned to transition into tech.

Me inscribi en 4Geeks con muy altas expectativas, y la verdad es que no me ha decepcionado. Me encontre con un programa muy bien pensado que no solo apunta al desarrollo tecnico en el desarrollo de software, si no que apoya dicha formacion con "side events" ... y un "career support" en el cual te orientan segun cuales sean los planes que tengas en mente con los conocimientos que adquieres a traves del programa. Respecto a la metodologia de enseñanza, es bastante dinamica y con un desafiante nivel de dificultad. A su vez, utilizan toda clase de herramientas para que no existan excusas al momento de tomar las clases (streaming y posterior disponibildad del video en una plataforma online). Debo decir que el lograr avances reales depende netamente del esfuerzo y tiempo que cada uno dedique al programa. Una de las cosas que mas me gusta es que puedo estar conectado con las otras sedes y hacer preguntas tecnicas que pueden ser respondidas por estudiantes y/o profesores de otras latitudes, generando una gran comunidad dispuesta a colaborar con los demas. Mi experiencia en 4Geeks ha sido tremendamente satisfactoria, ha valido cada peso que he invertido en el programa.

More than a review I’d like to tell my story. I took the part-time full stack web development bootcamp taught by 4Geeks, through Miami Dade College's continuing education department. I went into it unsure of what to expect as it was my first time diving into anything related to coding, but I ended ... up enjoying it immensely. This was due in large part to our instructor Jonathan who was encouraging, friendly, and engaging, and made it clear that there was no such thing as a "dumb question" in his class. He and the TAs Andy and Angelo were also always available on Slack for questions outside of class, as well as the rest of the 4Geeks community (the #publicsupport channel on Slack is a great place to ask questions). This course was the catalyst for an entire career change for me, and I'm excited to look for my first dev job now. Regarding curriculum, I would have liked to spend a bit more time on backend languages. We studied PHP in this particular course, but our larger projects were more robust on Javascript/React (which I'm also glad I learned!). But with that being said, this particular course was only 3 months and so there is only so much subject matter you can meaningfully squeeze in. Overall it was a good balance for the time that we had.

Mi decisión en unirme al bootcamp de 4Geeks Academy para ser un Full Stack Developer ha sido una de las mejores decisiones que he tomado. Mi nombre es Miguel y tengo 18 años. Todo empezó en mi escuela, donde había visto bases de programación muy básicas y me había llamado la atención, sin embargo no le hice mucho caso al tema. Cuando me gradué de mi colegio en noviembre (2022), iba a tener casi medio año de inactividad debido a que mi carrera universitaria la voy a estudiar en Madrid, España y empieza en septiembre (2023). Cuando supe que tendría medio año libre antes de comenzar mis estudios en Madrid, me vi enfrentado a una oportunidad de invertir en mí mismo y enfatizar la programación en mi vida. Después de haber investigado en internet diferentes bootcamps, encontré a 4Geeks Academy, la academia que ofrece un bootcamp para ser Full Stack Developer, el cual me brindaba la oportunidad de desarrollar conocimientos en el area de programación y el desarrollo de aplicaciones web. Desde el primer día en el bootcamp supe que había tomado la decisión correcta. Me di cuenta de que la programación era otra cosa en mi vida que en realidad me apasionaba hacer. Gracias a la metodología y los recursos que brindan, me motivaron muchísimo a aprender y desarrollar mis habilidades a profundidad. El apoyo que te brinda 4Geeks tanto mis profesores Oscar Miras y Sergio Araujo, como Victor Gómez, Marco Gómez y Ehiber Graterol es esencial, siempre están dispuestos a cualquier cosa que necesites y que la motivación y las ganas de aprender no se vayan nunca. El bootcamp me ofreció mucho más que aprender a programar, me permitió entrar en un entorno donde el trabajo en equipo y la colaboración es fundamental. Aprendí a comunicarme, compartir ideas y trabajar en proyectos con mis compañeros de clase. Unirme al bootcamp fue algo que influeció mucho mi vida y me hizo dar cuenta de que la programación y la tecnología es una pasión que no había tenido mucho en cuenta. Gracias a la academia y al bootcamp, tuve la oportunidad de tener una visión más clara  sobre lo que quería estudiar en la universidad y llevar a cabo a lo largo de mi vida, por lo que finalmente decidí estudiar Ingeniería Informática.

The pros are that you will have a large community supporting you. At the beginning you will be almost alone in the new world of programming when you do the pre-work for the course. At the beginning you will be almost alone in the new world of programming when you do the pre-work for the course. However, once you get to know your teacher and the rest of the students you will gradually realize that this seemingly lonely environment is actually a community where we all face the same challenges. We all support each other gradually, of course at the beginning you will be somewhat reticent, reserved, because it is not normal to find yourself in a world where community support is the norm and being alone, reserved, isolated without helping others or being helped is the least usual, although you can opt for that path, but I warn you that it will not be easy to opt for that path. This is a path of challenges, defeats that soon become triumphs. At the beginning you feel helpless and incapable but as you advance, you overcome stagnations and generate those euphoric victories, you become addicted to this world of programming. Of course, all this is thanks to the immense support that you have from all sides along the bootcamp, you forget that you are in remote because as soon as you ask for help, (yes, you have to get used to confess something as difficult as "I can't, I'm stuck, I don't see the error" and they tell you, you are missing a semicolon in that line) all the mechanisms move in your favor to convert into victories those jams that seem to have no end. In conclusion, this bootcamp delivers like no other. It teaches you to be passionate about this world, but it also makes you wonder if this is really the path you want to follow. Because no matter how smart you are, this river only flows if you are really determined to move forward without fear of waterfalls. The teachers and mentors are wonderful, at least the one I had, Emanuel Martinez, taught me more than any of my teachers throughout my life. Victor and Marcos make things clear and always encourage you to keep going despite everyone. The treatment is personal, the platforms are ready to be used, and they help you at all times, even when they let you hit the ground with your face. After finishing the bootcamp they help you build a resume you would have never imagined, perfect your linkedin and know well what you need to do to get the attention of recruiters. And rest assured that if you don't know how to tackle a programming or job search problem you have lifetime mentoring, the 4Geeks Slack community that is IMMENSE and all the support of your mentors at your disposal. The best investment of my entire life. Thanks to this bootcamp my life finally has a way to go after being more than 5 years spinning from one job to another like a spinning top. Thank you, 4Geeks Academy

I’ve been wanting to learn how to code but never found the time with a full time job, but then I saw 4GeeksAcademy offering a part time full stack bootcamp, and decided to spend a few hard months to learn. The part time structure was with 1 mentor and 1 assistant throughout the whole course for each lesson of 3 hours, 3 times a week, with a flip classroom concept of students are to learn before the class, and listen to explanation in class after already having gone through the ma... I’ve been wanting to learn how to code but never found the time with a full time job, but then I saw 4GeeksAcademy offering a part time full stack bootcamp, and decided to spend a few hard months to learn. The part time structure was with 1 mentor and 1 assistant throughout the whole course for each lesson of 3 hours, 3 times a week, with a flip classroom concept of students are to learn before the class, and listen to explanation in class after already having gone through the material. The bootcamp has a good structure easing in the ‘coding mindset’ with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and eventually SQL and Python. If I were to give a negative feedback, it would be that the slowly easing in front end was making it rather easy to digest, but when it came to backend and endpoints, it was rather fast paced comparing to the frontend part of the course - although I have to say I wasn’t an example student studying coding hardcore pushing everyday. For a full time working person, this is manageable, although I missed a few classes while traveling, Marta the mentor of my bootcamp offered mentorship sessions, to explain topics that I missed. I would definitely recommend - hours wise this is perfect for someone working full time office hours, although the 3x3 hours per week is not to be taken lightly - students are expected to learn and code on their own outside of the classes, to be able to follow the designed learning path. Mentors and assistants are very nice and friendly, passionate about coding as well as getting people to learn - the course also creates a great community within the class of ~6 people in my case, I believe it’s maximum 14 people in one class. There’s also lifetime support on the slack channels, finding a job, or just mentorship on anything. On the finance side, I have to say they offer a rather considerate support, they are in partnership with a payment/credit company, students can choose to pay in installments, as small as 100 euros a month, and obviously paying in full also works. (Not sure if this is only applicable in Europe)

Tras acabar de finalizar el Bootcamp de 4 Geeks Academy en la modalidad de part-time, puedo catalogar la experiencia como muy satisfactoria. Debido a que cuando inicié esta formación estaba trabajando, opté por esta modalidad y la verdad es que pocas desventajas o ninguna he encontrado con la formación presencial. Los medios didácticos empleados y la estructura del temario están muy estudiados y facilitan mucho la teleformación. Con el apoyo y seguimiento de los teachers, así como el servicio ilimitado de mentorías, además del esfuerzo personal, que no es poco, puedo asegurar que realmente aprendes a desarrollar. Todo el bootcamp tiene un enfoque práctico y aprendes programando con los lenguajes y tecnologías más demandados en el momento (Javascript, Python, React...). Así que si quieres reconvertirte como yo, o bien quieres adquirir unos conocimientos que te abran nuevas posibilidades laborales, puedo asegurar que el Bootcamp de 4 Geeks es una gran elección. Además, aunque yo no lo he necesitado, decir que el resto de mis compañeros ya están en empresas gracias a 4 Geeks, lo que me hace reafirmarme en este último comentario.

I'm thrilled to have choosing 4Geeks Academy when I was looking to change my career into coding. They specialized in Python, and that was one of the reasons I decided to do it. After 9 weeks of arduous work and a very challenging program, they started helping me a lot with tailored coaching for every job opportunity I was getting. We did several career support coaching sessions for around two months; we went thru my CV, my GitHub, LinkedIn, and made sure to publish my coding projects. They help me professionally write my personal story and also referred me to my current employer. It's been almost a year and they are always there for me; I'm still asking for help whenever I need it.

I had a great experience at 4Geeks, I still do. My teacher was great and the content is amazing. Considering I was almost clueless about anything regarding programming. I spent no less than 20 hours a week programming, and I was able to incorporate all the information. I still try to keep that ratio in order to assimilate everything, since it is impossible to pretend you know it all upon completing the bootcamp. I am super happy with the career support after the course is finished and I feel supported in every way by the academy, both alumni and faculty wise. I am proud to be a part of 4 Geeks. I would liked more Python, we were running out of time at the end of the bootcamp and we kind of rushed through it but I am completing it with the additional course included in my tuition.

The representative on the phone was giving me prices, even before we discussed the payment options, that don't match anything on the website. As a matter of fact, their price for the same online course varies from 3850-4600 if you pay upfront, whereas the representative was trying to sell me on the plan for 5300 telling me that he just applied some 1k discount to make it sound like a good deal. When I noticed when the website says and mentioned to him, on the next day he offered me to pay 4500. Overall, everything on their website is super confusing i.e. "*Discount up to €1700. From €4600 instead of €6300" or "pay upfront and get a discount", but turns out there is no additional discount. Anyhow, when I called him out on this later and tried to clarify how they come up with their prices, he avoided the question, got very rude and demanded that I pay up 6300 for the whole thing. On top of everything, this is a coding bootcamp, but they have failed to provide a safe payment system online and instead ask to make a weird wire transfer, or pay with crypto, which is super sketchy. They say you can pay by card, but that is actually not the case. These people just can't be trusted.

I started the course in April and currently I am in the final phase, working with my team on the final project. It has been a roller coaster of emotions and feelings, but I would definitely do it again. Throughout the course we got support from both our teacher and the teacher assistant. You can ask for mentorship sessions to build up on certain things or, in case you did not understand something, to review. It is very important that you ask questions. Revise, read everything there i... I started the course in April and currently I am in the final phase, working with my team on the final project. It has been a roller coaster of emotions and feelings, but I would definitely do it again. Throughout the course we got support from both our teacher and the teacher assistant. You can ask for mentorship sessions to build up on certain things or, in case you did not understand something, to review. It is very important that you ask questions. Revise, read everything there is to read and attend those sessions. You can't just attend the classes and call it a day. You need to program outside of the scheduled classes as well and the more you do, the better for you. Every module has at least one project, which has several levels and you can add more functionalities. I always tried to personalize things to make them more interesting. Sky really is the limit! At the beginning things look very overwhelming and scary, but once you notice the pattern and you reflect upon your progress, you realize that it works. You just need to have faith in the course and the way things are done. Talk to your classmates, to your teachers. Don't believe what that little voice in your head is telling you. Everybody struggles, some people are doing the exercises faster, some people are slower. Some are better in one module, but completely suck at the other one. Just keep on coding, it will get easier after some time. What I do definitely recommend is to reduce working hours when working on the final project. If you can, even take a vacation. Don't underestimate the task, you will need to code every single day and you most probably will face some technical issues which will require time.

Como estudiante del bootcamp de Full Stack Developer en 4Geeks, no puedo más que expresar mi gratitud y satisfacción por la experiencia. Unirme a este programa fue una decisión arriesgada -porque te cambia la vida- que no me arrepiento de haber tomado. El ritmo de las clases y de los proyectos está muy bien organizado y pensado para que aprendas progresivamente, con la cantidad de 'estrés' necesario para avanzar y sentirte desafiada, sin caer en la frustración que impide seguir adelante. Hay 10 horas de clases semanales y le dediqué el mismo tiempo o más fuera de clases para poder cumplir con los proyectos que se exigen en cada etapa. La dinámica de la clase también es muy interesante porque es esencialmente práctico y vas rotando con distintos compañeros para aprender en equipo y apoyarte en el conocimiento de los demás. El último mes te embarcas en la elaboración de un proyecto final que lleva muchísima dedicación y vas afianzando los contenidos, en equipo y con mucho apoyo y orientación de profesores y mentores. El equipo de 4Geeks está formado por verdaderos profesionales en el campo de la tecnología y el desarrollo web. Su pasión y dedicación por enseñar son evidentes en cada clase y mentoría. Lo más destacable es el conocimiento que tienen del proceso emocional que implica realizar el bootcamp, por eso están siempre anticipando los altibajos y las dificultades brindando apoyo adicional. Otro punto a destacar es el enfoque en proyectos prácticos y del mundo real, con un toque de diversión para hacerlo más ameno. El bootcamp es esencialmente práctico y colaborativo, una experiencia de aprendizaje distinta a las tradicionales. Además, 4Geeks tiene una amplia red de contactos y oportunidades de networking, esto te hace sentir mucho más acompañado cuando te lanzas a la búsqueda de empleo. Te acompañan paso a paso en la elaboración de tu CV y en la preparación de tus entrevistas. Sabes que cuentas con una comunidad de apoyo en estos primeros años de carrera.

In the first weeks of the course, we covered the basics of front-end development (html, css, javascript, and react), as well as complementary technologies required for working in an office environment (git, command line, etc). Subsequently, the training focused on interac... An excellent alternative for starting out in the world of programming For the past 16 weeks, I have been learning how to completely develop a web application at 4Geeks, and I have really enjoyed it. In the first weeks of the course, we covered the basics of front-end development (html, css, javascript, and react), as well as complementary technologies required for working in an office environment (git, command line, etc). Subsequently, the training focused on interacting with APIs, before creating one with SQLAlchemy, Python, and Flask. As well, we learned how to limit access to the API information. The last part of the course was a four-week final project that consisted of building a complete web application that put all the knowledge learned in the course to the test through a stream on the academy's YouTube channel. In each class, we had a teacher and an assistant who taught us the bases to carry out the exercises of the program meticulously. I have also benefited from unlimited mentoring provided by the school, which helped me to strengthen my knowledge and resolve any doubts I had throughout the bootcamp. In my opinion, the most valuable aspect of the academy is that all the teachers and mentors have been very willing to thoroughly teach me the content and to ensure that I understand the technologies. It's an atmosphere that's focused on total collaboration and helping you learn as much as possible (even remotely). 4Geeks is a great place to learn how to program, and with dedication on your part, you will surely learn a great deal about programming.

Muchos son los valientes que se embarcan en el heroico camino del aprendizaje del desarrollo de software desde las profundidades del desconocimiento, virando su destino de la aburrida vida ordinaria al maravilloso mundo del desarrollo... y terminan perdidos, sin los conocimientos o las habilidades necesarias para aprovechar las herramientas a su disposición. Bueno, pues eso no les hubiera ocurrido de haber estudiado en 4Geeks Academy. Con un currículum bien pensado, focalizado en enseñar de manera eficiente y rápida, pero con la profundidad necesaria las herramientas más demandadas en la actualidad, en 16 intensas semanas de aprendizaje estarás preparado para dar tus primeros pasos en este mundo entrando con buen pie. En este momento, si bien está sujeto a cambios para mantenerse siempre a la vanguardia del mercado, se enseña JavaScript con React para el desarrollo Frontend y Python con Flask para el desarrollo Backend, además de otras herramientas y conocimientos básicos, siendo estas tecnologías unas de las más demandadas (si no las más) en el actual mercado laboral del desarrollo. Si bien el curso es intenso y exigente, 4Geeks Academy ofrece mucho más de lo que demanda y, sin duda, puede ser el punto de inflexión perfecto en la vida de muchas personas que, como yo, opten por dar un giro radical a su vida haciendo un cambio de carrera y accediendo a uno de los mercados más grandes (y con mejores sueldos) en la actualidad. Además de esto, cabe destacar que, no solo cuentan con profesores y mentores muy bien preparados, si no que ofrecen apoyo para la búsqueda de empleo (incluyendo preparación para las temidas entrevistas técnicas) y un sistema de mentorías vitalicio, con lo que siempre podrás contar con el apoyo de la academia, incluso tiempo después de haber concluido la formación básica en ella.

I came to the U.S. from Cuba a long time ago and it has been a struggle ever since, I knew how to code but I was lacking the structure, technologies, and best practices, nobody would take me as a serious developer. It was hard to get a job and I end up giving up. After a while, I decided to give it another chance and I joined 4Geeks Academy and it was exactly what I needed, it gave me structure, they showed me how to apply my previous knowledge and combine it with everything I learn at the academy to create full-stack applications. At the academy they really encourage me to keep trying and believe in myself, I was able to confirm that I was good at this. Finally, a few months after graduation I have been accepted as a Software Engineer at my previous company and I'm earning a lot more money than before. Taking this course was the turning point in my career and now I feel that everything is just going to get better from here!

Recomiendo 100% a 4Geeks Academy porque es uno de los mejores bootcamps que hay en España. Muy buen contenido, tiene muchísimos ejercicios para practicar y proyectos interesantes que te ponen a prueba, no solo para desarrollar tus habilidades de código, sino también te enseñan a investigar y a convertirte en un programador independiente. El servicio de mentorías es buenísimo, si son ilimitadas de verdad, debido a una situación de trabajo perdí algunas clases y me ayudaron a ponerme al día. El staff de 4Geeks Academy Madrid es muy cercano, abierto a la crítica y siempre dispuesto a resolver cualquier duda o inconveniente que puedas tener, hacen mucho seguimiento al aprendizaje y te acompañan de verdad. Ya he terminado el programa y me han recomendado todo lo que debo hacer para continuar con mi carrera como programador, las mentorías continúan incluso después de haberme graduado y el servicio de carreras es totalmente personalizado. I had no previous experience in coding at all, but I always felt passionate about technologies and designs, creative things. So I decided to become a web developer. I chose this school, first of all because of good price (I have a payment plan), and second – I liked the curriculum. I enjoyed EACH class, because we start practice from the first class and it never was boring, no boring lectures, no boring typing, just a lot of knowledge in practice and much more fun! English is my third language, but I never felt misunderstand. Teachers explained everything very clearly. After graduation I was actively looking for a job and after 2 months (which is not bad) I found 1 paid project and a start-up company with paid and non-paid projects. Which is very good for the experience! And the best part of this school is that teachers still help me A LOT with my projects!!! I come to school once a week, or just text to the teacher and get quick respond and help. To summarize, This school gives enough knowledge to become a web developer and work by your own. Price is reasonable and the payment plan is good. Location is great too – right next to i95. And I like teachers so much, they are great! Thank you, 4Geek Academy for this opportunity to change my life <3

There is something about part-time that is clear: it has to be part-time for those having something else happening in their life. I just can't quit my job and learn software development. Although we had to work a lot after hours, with the exercises and projects they sent. You may need like 8 up to 10 hours more of work. There is a moment when you can get even obsessed with the exercise, because you actually wanted to work and sometimes just didn't, so it required more hours of extra work.

After talking to many schools and having a long day at work, I was displeased with talking to someone from 4Geeks Academy. During the whole conversion, it was apparent the person I was speaking to was annoyed, impatient, and seemed bothered. The person I was talking to became irritated when I couldn't recall specifics on their program and kept interrupting me with an annoyed voice "TELL ME WHAT A SOFTWARE ENGINEER IS" he said this almost three times as I was trying to explain how I was going about this career decision. At this point, I had lost all interest in this school (I found some experiences on a blog writing it off as sketchy after their first phone call and couldn't agree more!). This is an honest review, I recommend someone look for another school.

This Bootcamp is okay at best. I recently graduated from 4 Geeks. I feel like my cohort was cheated. There were times the instructor didn’t show up for a class or is running late. I recently graduated from 4 Geeks. I feel like my cohort was cheated. There were times the instructor didn’t show up for a class or is running late. When he did decide to show up the material was rushed. After graduating we are supposed to have job support but the support I had so far is a big disappointment. I am constantly working around the different instructor's time even when I book a session in advance to make sure I can get help. I work a full-time job and to come home to learn program, study, and update my resume, and apply for a job places a large strain on me mentally. Due to studying hours on end and physically due to sitting in a chair for hours to make sure I don't feel like I wasted my money on a course that promises good results if you follow their instructions and do what is asked of you and more. I did learn but it was a hassle and some restless days. if you are new to programming I would find an alternative Coding Bootcamp there are a lot of them out there with good reviews. I went with this one since it was in Miami. I would be able to attend the campus if needed and it was affordable compared to the other options. But the saying is true you get what you paid for. There are a couple of good mentors like Tomás and Paolo. I greatly appreciate them because I would have given up a long time ago but the overall not so great which ruined my experience and feels like a total waste, unfortunately.

4Geeks Academy fue y será una experiencia que cambió mi vida. Soy Comunicadora Social en marketing y publicidad, es un plus impresionante manejarnos en programación si queremos escalar en nuestros trabajos. Cuando pensé en el bootcamp de 4Geeks imaginé que podría ser un curso común y corrient... 4Geeks Academy fue y será una experiencia que cambió mi vida. Soy Comunicadora Social en marketing y publicidad, es un plus impresionante manejarnos en programación si queremos escalar en nuestros trabajos. Cuando pensé en el bootcamp de 4Geeks imaginé que podría ser un curso común y corriente de formación en Desarrollo de Software, pero desde la entrevista hasta el día de hoy (varios meses después) valoro mucho las puertas de esta academia. Siempre me sentí en un ambiente de capacitación profesional que superó mis expectativas; tienen profesores y un team que está en constante apoyo. Hacen eventos gratuitos de interés para seguir formando, lo cual me permitió conocer a personas en el área de software. Además la academia me permitió conseguir un trabajo de calidad que jamás pensé que podía llegar a obtener y mucho menos en el área de tecnología. Aún sigo dentro de la comunidad de 4Geeks y sin duda fue una de las mejores oportunidades y decisiones que he tomado en mi ámbito personal y laboral. ¡Gracias al excelente equipo!

Si estás buscando un bootcamp donde te lleven de la mano en cada paso, este no es para ti. Es un programa que exige mucha dedicación, especialmente si vienes de una rama totalmente distinta al desarrollo. Hay que investigar mucho por cuenta propia y comprometerse al 100% para realmente sacarle provecho.

Dicho esto, la escuela ofrece un gran apoyo. Hay muchas mentorías disponibles y el equipo está siempre dispuesto a ayudar. Hans, en particular, es un excelente profesor. Te exige, te motiva y te da el empujón necesario para que saques lo mejor de ti. Además, brinda mucho contexto sobre cómo es realmente el trabajo en la industria.

En cuanto a la búsqueda de empleo, la escuela te respalda muchísimo en todo el proceso. Pero quiero destacar especialmente a Melisa: es una genia en lo que hace. Si tienes la oportunidad de recibir su guía, aprovéchala al máximo.
En resumen, es un bootcamp desafiante pero muy valioso. Si estás dispuesto a esforzarte y comprometerte, vale totalmente la pena.Less
